title.narrative: The Peru Nexus Project: Knowledge exchange on the Water-Energy-Food nexus concept in Santa Eulalia sub-basin

description.narrative: The Santa Eulalia river sub-basin in Peru provides 50% of the water needs and 70% of the electricity needs of metropolitan Lima. Moreover, the basin produces a wide variety of fruits (custard apples and avocados) and vegetables that are sold in Lima.Climatic variability compounded by climate change results in decreased availability of and access to natural resources (mainly water and food). This affects local populations directly and metropolitan Lima indirectly. The Netherlands Government supports the Peruvian Government in integrating Water, Energy and Food (WEF) nexus aspects in its sustainable development and climate change policies in which water, energy and agri&food are integrated. This project focuses on organising roundtable discussions on water-energy-Agri&food sector to facilitate knowledge exchange in the WEF nexus approach. In addition, partnerships will be started between Dutch and Peruvian knowledge institutions how the nexus approach can be incorporated into the curricula of academic institutions and vocational schools in Peru.The WEF nexus approach will result in more efficient use of water, energy and food resources, enhanced resilience to the impact of climate change, improved agricultural practices and the development of the local private sector in the Santa Eulalia river sub-basin.
